blocks.name: tgifscgr
blocks.content: Inner five segment congruence. Take two triangles, ` A D C ` and ` E H K ` , with ` B ` between ` A ` and ` C ` and ` F ` between ` E ` and ` K ` . If the other components of the triangles are congruent, then so are ` B D ` and ` F H ` . Theorem 4.2 of [Schwabhauser] p. 34. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Mar-2019.)
blocks.origin:

  ad6antr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c5), wa(wcel(c11, co(c10, c7, cv(hs1))), wceq(co(c11, c1, cv(hs1)), co(c9, c1, cv(hs0)))), wceq(co(c9, c1, c2), co(c11, c1, c4)))
  axtgsegcon(hs1, c5, c11, c10, c7, c1, c9, cv(hs0), c6, wa(wa(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)), wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0)))))
  ad2antrr(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))), wcel(c6, cstrkg))
  ad4antr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))), wcel(c10, c5))
  ad4antr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))), wcel(c11, c5))
  ad2antrr(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))), wcel(c9, c5))
  simplr(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)), wcel(cv(hs0), c5), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0))))
  tgbtwndiff(hs0, c5, c9, c8, c7, c6, c1, wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)))
  ad2antrr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(c6, cstrkg))
  ad2antrr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(c8, c5))
  ad2antrr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9), wcel(c9, c5))
  simplr(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5)), wne(c8, c9))
  tgldimor(c5, cbs, c6, c8, w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c3, c1, c4)))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wa(wa(wa(w0, wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, c5))), wne(c8, c9)), wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wa(wcel(c9, co(c8, c7, cv(hs0))), wne(c9, cv(hs0)))))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c3, c1, c4)))
  diff.hs1.c(c5)
  diff.hs1.c(c11)
  diff.hs1.c(c10)
  diff.hs1.c(c7)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)

blocks.name: tgcgrsub
blocks.content: Removing identical parts from the end of a line segment preserves congruence. Theorem 4.3 of [Schwabhauser] p. 35. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm tgcgrsub(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c3, c1, c4)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cds, c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(citv, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cstrkg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c0, c7, c8)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, co(c3, c7, c9)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c8), co(c3, c1, c9)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c2, c1, c8), co(c4, c1, c9)))
} = {
  tgcgrcomlr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  tgifscgr(c2, c1, c0, c4, c3, c5, c6, c7, c0, c8, c3, c9, w0)
  tgcgrtriv(c0, c1, c3, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  tgcgrcomlr(c8, c1, c0, c9, c3, c5, c6, c7, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm tgcgrsub(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[c1]c2)=(c3[c1]c4))
  ⊣ c5 =(Base ` c6)
  ⊣ c1 =(dist ` c6)
  ⊣ c7 =(Itv ` c6)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ TarskiG)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c8 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c9 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈(c0[c7]c8))
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈(c3[c7]c9))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0[c1]c8)=(c3[c1]c9))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c2[c1]c8)=(c4[c1]c9))
} = {
  tgcgrcomlr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  tgifscgr(c2, c1, c0, c4, c3, c5, c6, c7, c0, c8, c3, c9, w0)
  tgcgrtriv(c0, c1, c3, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  tgcgrcomlr(c8, c1, c0, c9, c3, c5, c6, c7, w0)
}
